bill.title: Retirement; participants in optional retirement program may become PERS members and purchase credit for previous service.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-413, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Three-month Period During Which Any Participant In The Optional Retirement Program (orp) For Employees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning May Cease Participating In The Orp And Become A Member Of The Public Employees' Retirement System (pers); To Provide That Any Person Who Becomes A Member Of Pers Under This Provision Shall Retain All Benefits Earned Under The Orp Up To The Date That The Person Became A Member Of Pers, But Shall Not Make Any Further Contributions To The Orp; To Amend Section 25-11-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Participants In The Orp Who Cease Participation In The Orp And Become A Member Of Pers Shall Be Entitled To Receive A Maximum Of Ten Years Creditable Service For Service Rendered As A Teaching Or Administrative Faculty Employee Of A State Institution Of Higher Learning In Mississippi While Participating In The Orp; To Require The Member To Pay Into Pers The Actuarial Cost As Determined By The Actuary For Each Year, Or Portion Thereof, Of That Service; And For Related Purposes.
